text: by December 11, 2024 Time for a peek at how the next year in cinema is shaping up. üëÄ Every new year brings another Sundance Film Festival and with less than two months until Sundance 2025 kicks off on January 23rd, it's time to find out what is premiering at this prestigious fest in Utah. Sundance has revealed their 2025 selection of official feature films debuting in January, featuring 87 films playing across 11 main categories (including their usual four Competition categories), including fun documentaries, clever comedies, thought-provoking dramas, and more. The 2025 festival is taking place both as an in-person festival returning to snowy Park City, UT (before they move elsewhere), as well as a virtual festival with online premieres only available for the second half. Sundance is still one of the greatest indie fests in the world, and this will be our 19th year in a row returning to cover it & discover films. "Our curation speaks to the breadth and depth of filmmaking today, and the work of the artists selected showcases the potential for storytelling to drive change." Let's go. Eugene Hernandez, current director of the Sundance Film Festival & Public Programming, states: "This year's program is ready to meet our audiences, the industry, and the wider culture in a moment of many global questions. The works our artists will debut at our upcoming Festival will spark conversation & invite connection. We're excited to be sharing these moments of discovery together with our communities soon and thankful to our artists for entrusting us with their stories." Director of Programming Kim Yutani adds: "This year's program presents stories that confront many critical issues of our time, encouraging us to look both inward and outward. As always, we're excited to introduce audiences to new voices, alongside new work from some familiar names. Audiences at the Festival can not only look forward to engaging with the unexpected, but also to be entertained, challenged, and deeply moved by this year's films." Ready to watch. Time for a peek at how the next year in cinema is shaping up. üëÄ Every new year brings another Sundance Film Festival and with less than two months until Sundance 2025 kicks off on January 23rd, it's time to find out what is premiering at this prestigious fest in Utah. Sundance has revealed their 2025 selection of official feature films debuting in January, featuring 87 films playing across 11 main categories (including their usual four Competition categories), including fun documentaries, clever comedies, thought-provoking dramas, and more. The 2025 festival is taking place both as an in-person festival returning to snowy Park City, UT (before they move elsewhere), as well as a virtual festival with online premieres only available for the second half. Sundance is still one of the greatest indie fests in the world, and this will be our 19th year in a row returning to cover it & discover films. "Our curation speaks to the breadth and depth of filmmaking today, and the work of the artists selected showcases the potential for storytelling to drive change." Let's go.

Eugene Hernandez, current director of the Sundance Film Festival & Public Programming, states: "This year's program is ready to meet our audiences, the industry, and the wider culture in a moment of many global questions. The works our artists will debut at our upcoming Festival will spark conversation & invite connection. We're excited to be sharing these moments of discovery together with our communities soon and thankful to our artists for entrusting us with their stories." Director of Programming Kim Yutani adds: "This year's program presents stories that confront many critical issues of our time, encouraging us to look both inward and outward. As always, we're excited to introduce audiences to new voices, alongside new work from some familiar names. Audiences at the Festival can not only look forward to engaging with the unexpected, but also to be entertained, challenged, and deeply moved by this year's films." Ready to watch.
